text:
We are using tomcat 3.2.1. and the nightly struts build of 2001-05-04

The file upload mechanism of struts does not working if mod_jk and ajp13 is 
used. I just switched to ajp12 and everything is fine.

The files are created in the work dir, but they have size 0. The client browser 
just hangs after the request is submitted. 

The form works if I do not submit a file.

simon
creator: develop@outermedia.de
rde@webtrak.co.uk
text:
There is a problem in Ajp13ConnectorRequest.doRead() - the next byte from the
buffer is returned as an int and therefore sign-extended.  Changing the return
to
        return bodyBuff[pos++] & 0xff;

fixes at least the file upload problems I am having at present.

This seems to now be an ajp13 issue according to additional comments from 
Richard Evans, so I'll change the status to "REMIND", in the event that this
is an issue that needs to be addressed by the upload package also.
creator: mschachter@bluestone.com
rde@webtrak.co.uk
text:
This buig is still present in the latest tomcat 3.3 builds.  How can we get it
fixed?  My company is reluctant to use software which we have to fix ourslelves
when each new release comes out.

creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
text: Fixed in 3.2.3-dev.  Should be fixed shortly in 3.3
*** Bug 1678 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
nacho@apache.org
text: *** Bug 2208 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
The fix has been applied to Tomcat 3.3
creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
